glsa.summary: FreeRADIUS heap exploit and NULL pointer derefence exploits
glsa.description:
FreeRADIUS versions below 0.9.3 are vulnerable to a heap exploit, however, the attack code must be in the form of a valid RADIUS packet which limits the possible exploits.
Also corrected in the 0.9.3 release is another vulnerability which causes the RADIUS server to de-reference a NULL pointer and crash when an Access-Request packet with a Tunnel-Password is received.
Please see the announcement at: http://www.securitytracker.com/alerts/2003/Nov/1008263.html for more details regarding the issue.

solution.description: Users are encouraged to perform an 'emerge --sync' and upgrade the package to the latest available version - 0.9.3 is available in portage and is marked as stable.
